raw_comment: I've noticed that most countries that think the world is becoming a better place with each coming generation tend to be less wealthy than countries that think the world is becoming a worse place like Spain, France, and the United Kingdom. And I also noticed that Indonesia is a pretty big outlier, standing out from the rest by a decent amount. I wonder if that the reason many wealthier countries elder generation don't think that the world is becoming better with every generation is because of the wealth of that country or perhaps it is much deeper than that and is maybe due to how the older generation was raised and that they may fear change or think of change as a negative thing. In my community most teens including me think that yes the world is becoming a better place with every generation, but i couldn't really speak for the older generation.
ace_sentences: I noticed a pattern.
Many countries have people who think that the world is becoming a better place with each coming generation.
These countries tend to be less wealthy than some other countries.
Spain is a country.
France is a country.
The United Kingdom is a country.
In Spain, in France, and in the United Kingdom, many people think that the world is becoming a worse place with each coming generation.
I noticed that Indonesia is an outlier.
Indonesia stands out from the other countries by a decent amount.
I wonder about a reason.
Many wealthier countries have an older generation.
In many wealthier countries, the older generation does not think that the world is becoming better with every generation.
I wonder whether this is because of the wealth of the country.
I also wonder whether this is due to how the older generation was raised.
Some older people may fear change.
Some older people may think that change is a negative thing.
I live in a community.
In my community, most teens think that the world is becoming a better place with every generation.
I am a teen.
I think that the world is becoming a better place with every generation.
I cannot speak for the older generation in my community.
